meanings.definition: To place or set in a particular location or position.
meanings.sent1: I will colocate the books on the shelf neatly.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked us to colocate our desks in a straight line.
meanings.sent3: Let's colocate the toys in the toy chest for a tidy room.
meanings.sent4: She decided to colocate the flowers in a beautiful arrangement.
meanings.sent5: Colocating the ingredients before cooking makes the process smoother.

meanings.definition: To share a location or space with something else.
meanings.sent1: The birds and squirrels collocate peacefully in the park.
meanings.sent2: Our office will colocate with another company in the same building.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog collocate on the cozy rug for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The stars collocate in the night sky, creating a stunning view.
meanings.sent5: Colocating the plants in the garden helps them thrive together.
